result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah Dominique Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court granted Huber privileges for work and child care. Court allows for Good Time Credit

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution set at zero.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- Cooperate with agent.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Contact the Probation Department today.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah Dominique Williams

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  Defendant's Character Letter

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Elijah Dominique Williams.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and child care.  Court allows for good time credit. 

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens. 
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment. 
- Complete 50 hours of community service. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. 
- Cooperate with agent.   
- 6 months driver's license revocation. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- Contact the probation department today. 

Court set restitution at zero.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Firearm and voting warnings given. 20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Certification of Completion: Driver's Safety Course
Certificate of Completion: Driver's Safety Course; received and filed.
Sentencing letters; Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Elijah Dominique Williams.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing adjourned in Branch 02.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  Defense had discovery and the state's offer requesting an additional status conference.  The court grants defense request and order the matter adjourned back to Branch 2 via zoom  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court with Attorney Ashley Fard on behalf of Attorney Amanda Poznanski; they appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Elijah Dominique Williams in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elijah Dominique Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
